name: The Wyndham Arms Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went here with my husband for a lovely weekend away. The staff were really welcoming and helpful in every way. We stayed in one of the four poster rooms, which was classic in style - could do witha little loving care though. Bed was comfy. The atmosphere downstairs was relaxed and homely. We were going to sit in the restaurant but changed our minds to sit in the bar as it is not your typical pub bar, but is warm and inviting. The food was AMAZING! One of the best meals I have ever eaten. Charlie went out of his way to make us feel wlecome and he also managed to get the heating working as we stayed on the coldest night so far in 2011.
reviews.title: Lovely break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only comment I would make to the manager is that the upstairs needs a bit of love, a lick of paint and it would upgrade the rooms beautifully.
reviews.title: Lovely country retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for a lovely night.
reviews.title: DODGY HOTEL - DON'T STAY HERE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived for a one night stay for me, my husband, 9 year old daughter and our 3 year old Yorkie Dog, Whisky. A totally relaxing quiet place away from our busy city lives. We were kindly greeted by Nigel the Owner on our arrival to be given one of the family rooms, room 26. A large
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay and enjoy the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bedroom, with a large bathroom, very spacious although could do with modernising ie painting.
reviews.title: Fantastic relaxing place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were guests at a wedding at nearby Clearwell Castle and extended our stay to 4 nights in order to renew acquaintance with the Forest of Dean. We had a double downstairs room in the annex at £90 per night including breakfast.
reviews.title: On the one hand ...on the other!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a country pub doing b&b.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others have accurately commented about the accommodation showing its age. The flat screen t.v. apart, the rooms are exactly as they would have been 10 or 20 years ago -including blankets rather than duvets on the beds - and generally showing more than a few signs of wear and tear. Rather more attention to housekeeping would also be beneficial.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food, however, was excellent and would merit a 5 star rating. The pub has not gone "gastro" and with some exceptions the menu - up-dated daily in accord with seasonal availability - tends towards the traditional with emphasis on prime ingredients from local suppliers. We particularly enjoyed the duck liver parfait, the game casserole and the selection of local cheeses. There is a small, but very adequate wine list from Tanners of Shrewsbury.
reviews.title: a lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Excellent breakfasts were freshly prepared to order.
reviews.title: Average...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on a three nights for two DBB break and stayed in the Annex. Room was lovely and spacious - excellent shower, lovely soft towels. The staff were friendly and the food was great - although we couldn't manage three courses every night and a little too much Rock Salt was used. The atmosphere in the bar was lovely and i'm sure even better in the Winter with the fire going. Breakfast was the best we've had for ages, delicious bacon and sausages that were so packed full of meat - no gristle or added water. There was a problem with the timing of meals on one night due to a problem in the kitchen, but staff did their best and even offered a free drink. The road outside was also being resurfaced, but to be honest you didn't notice it other then to come and go from the hotel when you had to pick your route carefully. All in all a great base for exploring the area. We certainly hope to return.
reviews.title: Charming Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We needed to cheer ourselves up having dropped our eldest daughter off at Cardiff University, so we were all feeling pretty miserable but we managed to have a great time.
reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - SUPERB LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were treated to a very friendly welcome by Charlie the manager who made a real fuss of the kids which really cheered them up.
reviews.title: "Girls" Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fabulous meal in the restaurant which is stunning and the food was fantastic, as was the sevice- even though there isn't a kids menu the kids were really well catered for and they had a very enjoyable meal .
reviews.title: FABULOUS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids had a real treat in the morning when we took them up to see the pigs who followed them everywhere - they are really cute.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wyndham Arms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The chap who welcomed us was friendly and helpfull (as he had been on the phone a couple of days previous), and this feeling of warmth ran right through the place and the staff till the moment we left. Everywhere we went throughout the premises from reception through the bar, the restaraunt and the room were full of character and give a proper sense of a "homely" place to stay.
reviews.title: Our stay 22nd-23rd October 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was spot on and I'll bet the food was sourced locally as it had that fresh, free range taste to it.
reviews.title: Weekend in The Forest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely place that we WILL be coming back to.
reviews.title: Lovely country hotel with probably the best food I've ever had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked on line and asked for a downstairs room as we have an "old" dog. Only room available was on the first floor in the annex. Room was great. Large, warm and comfortable.
reviews.title: One nights stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed sitting in the bar and decided to eat there rather than the restaurant. We thought it was a better atmosphere.
reviews.title: A lovely weekend away

aka: The Wyndham Arms Hotel Clearwell, Gloucestershire
description: Oozing with period features, log fires and rustic charm, The Wyndham Arms Hotel is situated in the picturesque village of Clearwell between the beautiful Wye Valley and the Royal Forest of Dean. The hotel offers the closest accommodation to Clearwell Castle, the famous wedding venue, but is also ideal for those who enjoy walking, cycling and golfing in the Forest of Dean or simply wish for a romantic time away in a cosy inn with great food. The Wyndham Arms Hotel offers eighteen en-suite rooms of several types of comfortable accommodation from single rooms to double and twin rooms to family rooms to beamed four poster bedrooms and a sumptuous suite. The accommodation is situated in both the Manor House (circa 1347) and the adjoining Annex. The hotel bar combines rustic charm with a contemporary edge with oak flooring and tables and a large open fire place creating a relaxed atmosphere for lounging, drinking or casual dining. Local ales, cider and country wines accompany the menu offering classic pub classics with an up-to-date twist. The 'Old Spot' Country Restaurant is complete with a domed 'gaol', open stone walls, old oak beams and an open fire place. The exciting menu takes full advantage of the fresh, local and seasonal produce, cooked and simply presented to appeal to those who enjoy good food and described by Paddy Burt of The Daily Telegraph as '.....great stuff.....' Whether it's candlelight romance or relaxing with good company, our charming restaurant creates the perfect atmosphere.
